sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都表示"完整的，全部的，整个的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: entire, whole, complete, full, total, gross, all
means: entire ： 除了有whole的意思外，还强调既不能加一个也不减少一个的含义。
whole比entire更普通，强调每个组成部分都包括在内，无一漏掉或舍去。
complete ： 强调事物在内容、程度、或数量方面已完整，已达标准。
full ： 侧重指内容，含有能包括所有的充足内容的意味。
total与complete用法相近，但强调总量。
gross ： 侧重指未打折扣，未除去成本或皮重等与净重、净数相对。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"粗鲁的，粗俗的"之意。
means: vulgar ： 侧重指对听者的冒犯，往往强调粗野，言行、趣味不高，缺乏教养。
coarse ： 指缺乏教养，言谈粗俗，举止粗野，可与vulgar换用。
crude与vulgar同义，也指言谈举止粗俗，不文雅，缺乏教养。
gross ： 语气强烈，指粗鲁、无礼貌，令人讨厌。

word_mean: 大体的，肉眼的，粗的：肉眼能观察的，如大体病理学，肉眼检查的，不精细的

jx.jx_cn_mean: 使厌恶：令人充满厌恶，使恶心

lj.lj_ly: “The trick in making a family film . . . is finding ways to interest grown-ups without boring, confusing, or grossing out the younger set”(&b{Christian Science Monitor})

lj.lj_ly: impoverished Mexicans who were arrested here by the gross.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly N. Amer.)disgust someone with repulsive or obscene behaviour or appearance
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主北美)使…作呕，令…恶心

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'thick, massive, bulky'): from Old French gros, grosse 'large', from late Latin grossus

entry.def: You use gross to describe something unacceptable or unpleasant to a very great amount, degree, or intensity.

example.ex: The company were guilty of gross negligence.

entry.tran: （言语、行为）极端粗俗的，下流的
entry.def: If you say that someone's  speech or behaviour is gross, you think it is very rude or unacceptable.

example.ex: He abused the Admiral in the grossest terms...
example.tran: 他用不堪入耳的话辱骂那位海军上将。

example.ex: I feel disgusted and wonder how I could ever have been so gross.
example.tran: 我感到无地自容，不知道自己怎么会变得如此粗俗。

entry.tran: 令人不快的；让人恶心的；令人厌恶的
entry.def: If you describe something as gross, you think it is very unpleasant.

example.ex: They had a commercial on the other night for Drug Free America that was so gross I thought Daddy was going to faint...
example.tran: 他们前几天晚上为“美国远离毒品”组织播的那则广告非常恶心，我觉得爸爸看了都快晕过去了。

example.ex: He wears really gross holiday outfits.
example.tran: 他穿着十分难看的节日服装。

entry.def: If you describe someone as gross, you mean that they are extremely fat and unattractive.

example.ex: I only resist things like chocolate if I feel really gross.
example.tran: 我只有在觉得自己胖得很难看的时候才能拒绝巧克力这类东西的诱惑。

entry.def: Gross means the total amount of something, especially money, before any has been taken away.

example.ex: ...a fixed rate account guaranteeing 10.4% gross interest or 7.8% net until October.
example.tran: 10月份之前保证10.4%的毛利或7.8%的纯利收益的固定利率账户

entry.def: Gross means the total amount of something, after all the relevant amounts have been added together.

example.ex: National Savings gross sales in June totalled £709 million.
example.tran: 6月份国民储蓄机构的总销售额为7.09亿英镑。

entry.def: Gross means the total weight of something, including its container or wrapping.

entry.tran: （扣除税金前）总共赚得，总收入为
entry.def: If a person or a business grosses a particular amount of money, they earn that amount of money before tax has been taken away.

example.ex: I'm a factory worker who grossed £12,900 last year...
example.tran: 我是个工厂工人，去年的总收入为12,900英镑。

example.ex: So far the films have grossed more than £590 million.
example.tran: 到目前为止，这些电影的票房总收入已超过了5.9亿英镑。

entry.def: A gross is a group of 144 things.

example.ex: He ordered twelve gross of the disks.

means.word_mean: 2. the entire amount of income before any deductions are made
2. visible to the naked eye (especially of rocks and anatomical features)
3. of general aspects or broad distinctions;

sentences.sentence: "the gross details of the structure appear reasonable"

means.word_mean: 5. conspicuously and outrageously bad or reprehensible;
6. without qualification; used informally as (often pejorative) intensifiers;

sentences.sentence: "full of language so vulgar it should have been edited"

list.explanation: [青少年用语]令人讨厌 (的)、深恶痛极(的)、作呕(的)人、行为或事物

example.en: That horror movie was a real gross-out.
example.zh: 那部恐怖片真是一部叫人倒胃口的电影。

example.en: What a gross-out day has been!
He attempts the ultimate gross-out "self-expression" of the kind found in Greenwich Village.
example.zh: 他试图摆出那副臭架子格林威治村里的那种"自我表现"的神气。

Sentence.sentence: The decline started in the 1950s, when manufacturing generated a sturdy 28% of the national income, or gross domestic product, and employed one-third of the workforce.
It generated just 12% of the gross national income
It constituted 28% of the gross domestic product.

means.word_mean: 臃肿的; 肥胖而丑陋的

sentences.en: He's not just fat.He's positively gross!
sentences.cn: 他不只是胖, 他是过于肥胖！

sentences.en: The gross weight of the box of chocolates is 500 grams.
sentences.cn: 那盒巧克力的全部重量是500克。

means.word_mean: 显而易见的, 显然恶劣的

sentences.en: Her last film grossed a million pounds.
sentences.cn: 她拍最后一部影片总共赚了100万英镑。

jushi.chinese: 那盒巧克力的总重量是500克。
